definition: lit. interrelated as bones and flesh (idiom); inseparably related/closely intertwined
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: But flesh with film is shot connected.
sentences.chinese: 而镜头与电影更是骨肉相连。

definition: one's own flesh and blood (idiom); closely related
blood is thicker than water/fig. family ties are closer than social relations
beef grilled on a hot iron plate
eggplant served sizzling on a hot iron plate
